tool.title: ARW to JPG
tool.subtitle: Convert Sony ARW RAW to JPG

faqs.question: What is ARW format?
faqs.answer: Sony's proprietary RAW image format

faqs.question: Why convert ARW to JPG?
faqs.answer: Converting from ARW to JPG can provide benefits like excellent compression, universal compatibility, good for photographs.

faqs.question: Will I lose quality during conversion?
faqs.answer: The conversion maintains optimal quality. We use high-quality settings to ensure the best possible output while keeping file sizes reasonable.

faqs.question: Is my data secure?
faqs.answer: Yes! All conversions happen locally in your browser. Your files never leave your device and aren't uploaded to any server, ensuring complete privacy and security.

faqs.question: Can I convert multiple files at once?
faqs.answer: Yes! You can select and convert multiple files simultaneously. Each file is processed individually and downloaded automatically when ready.

faqs.question: What's the maximum file size?
faqs.answer: Since processing happens in your browser, the limit depends on your device's available memory. Most modern devices can handle files up to several hundred megabytes.

name: Audio to Text
description: Transcribe audio and video files to text

tool.title: Audio to Text
tool.subtitle: Transcribe audio or video files to text from uploads or public links.

howTo.title: How to transcribe audio or video to text
howTo.intro: Follow these steps to turn audio into a readable transcript.
steps: Upload an audio or video file, or paste a public link.
Wait while we extract the audio and transcribe it.
Download the transcript or copy the text.

infoArticle.title: About audio and video transcription
infoArticle.markdown:
Audio to Text transcribes speech from audio or video files. Uploaded files are processed in your browser. If you paste a public link, the server fetches the media and streams it to your browser for transcription. The speech model downloads on first use and runs locally.

This tool is best for interviews, meetings, lectures, and voice notes. Larger files take longer to process and may use more memory.

**Why use this tool**

- Handles uploads or public links.
- Creates a plain text transcript you can edit or share.
- Works with common audio and video formats.

faqs.question: Do my files get uploaded?
faqs.answer: Uploads are processed locally in your browser. If you paste a public link, the server fetches the media and streams it to your browser. The model files are downloaded when needed.

faqs.question: Which file types are supported?
faqs.answer: Common audio and video formats like MP3, WAV, M4A, AAC, FLAC, OGG, OPUS, MP4, MOV, MKV, WEBM, AVI, and M4V.

faqs.question: Can I use YouTube or SoundCloud links?
faqs.answer: Yes for public links. Private or logged-in content is not supported yet.

faqs.question: Why is the first run slower?
faqs.answer: The speech model downloads the first time you run the tool. After that it is cached for faster use.

faqs.question: What does the output look like?
faqs.answer: You get a plain text transcript (.txt) that you can download or copy.

faqs.question: What is AVIF format?
faqs.answer: AVIF (AV1 Image File Format) is a modern image format that provides superior compression compared to JPEG, PNG, and even WebP. It was developed by the Alliance for Open Media and supports both lossy and lossless compression.

faqs.question: Why convert AVIF to JPG?
faqs.answer: While AVIF offers better compression and quality, JPG/JPEG is still the most widely supported image format across all devices, browsers, and applications. Converting AVIF to JPG ensures maximum compatibility for sharing and viewing images.

faqs.question: Is the conversion done on my device?
faqs.answer: Yes! All conversions happen directly in your browser. Your images never leave your device, ensuring complete privacy and security. No files are uploaded to any server.

faqs.question: What's the maximum file size I can convert?
faqs.answer: Our converter can handle files up to 50MB each. For larger files, consider using desktop software or breaking them into smaller batches.

faqs.question: Will I lose quality when converting from AVIF to JPG?
faqs.answer: Some quality loss may occur since JPG uses different compression algorithms than AVIF. However, we optimize the conversion to maintain the best possible quality while keeping file sizes reasonable.

faqs.question: Can I convert multiple AVIF files at once?
faqs.answer: Yes! You can select or drag multiple AVIF files to convert them all to JPG format in one batch. Each file will be processed and downloaded individually.

faqs.question: Is AVIF transparency preserved?
faqs.answer: Yes, AVIF images with alpha channels are converted to PNG with full transparency support. The conversion maintains all transparency information perfectly.

faqs.question: Why convert AVIF to PNG?
faqs.answer: While AVIF offers superior compression, PNG has universal support across all software and platforms. Many design tools and older systems don't support AVIF yet.

faqs.question: Will HDR content be preserved?
faqs.answer: HDR AVIF images are tone-mapped to standard dynamic range for PNG output, as PNG doesn't support HDR. The conversion aims to preserve as much visual information as possible.

faqs.question: How much larger will PNG files be?
faqs.answer: PNG files are typically 3-5x larger than AVIF files. The exact increase depends on image content, with photographs showing the largest size increase.

faqs.question: Can I batch convert AVIF files?
faqs.answer: Yes, you can select multiple AVIF files for batch conversion. Each file is processed individually and downloaded automatically.

name: CSV Combiner
description: Combine multiple CSV files into one

tool.title: CSV Combiner
tool.subtitle: Merge multiple CSV files into one seamlessly in your browser.

faqs.question: How does CSV combining work?
faqs.answer: Our CSV combiner merges multiple CSV files by aligning columns with matching headers. It intelligently handles different column orders and missing columns, creating a unified dataset.

faqs.question: What happens to duplicate headers?
faqs.answer: When files have the same column headers, the data is merged vertically (rows are appended). If headers differ, new columns are created and empty cells are filled with blank values for missing data.

faqs.question: Is there a file size limit?
faqs.answer: You can combine CSV files up to 50MB each. The tool processes files locally in your browser, so performance depends on your device's memory.

faqs.question: Can I combine files with different encodings?
faqs.answer: Yes, the tool automatically detects and handles various text encodings including UTF-8, UTF-16, and ASCII, ensuring proper character display in the merged file.

faqs.question: How are different delimiters handled?
faqs.answer: The combiner auto-detects delimiters (comma, semicolon, tab, pipe) in each file and standardizes them to your chosen output format.

tool.title: GIF to PNG
tool.subtitle: Convert GIF images to PNG format with better quality and smaller sizes.

faqs.question: What happens to animated GIFs?
faqs.answer: Animated GIFs are converted to a static PNG of the first frame. For full animation extraction, each frame can be saved as a separate PNG file.

faqs.question: Is transparency preserved?
faqs.answer: Yes, GIF transparency is fully preserved in the PNG output. PNG actually handles transparency better with full alpha channel support versus GIF's binary transparency.

faqs.question: Will the quality improve?
faqs.answer: PNG supports millions of colors compared to GIF's 256 color limit. While we can't add detail that wasn't there, gradients and colors will be preserved better.

faqs.question: Why is my PNG smaller than the GIF?
faqs.answer: For simple graphics, PNG's compression is often more efficient than GIF, resulting in smaller files with better quality.

faqs.question: Can I convert old GIF images?
faqs.answer: Yes, converting old GIFs to PNG is a great way to preserve them with better quality and prepare them for modern use.

faqs.question: What's the difference between JPG and JPEG?
faqs.answer: There's no difference - they're the same format. JPEG is the full name, while JPG was used for older Windows systems that required 3-letter extensions.

faqs.question: Will I lose photo quality?
faqs.answer: There's minimal quality loss with our optimized conversion. We use high-quality settings to preserve as much detail as possible while ensuring compatibility.

faqs.question: Are Live Photos supported?
faqs.answer: The still image from Live Photos is converted to JPEG. The motion component requires video format conversion for full preservation.

faqs.question: Can I convert HEIC burst photos?
faqs.answer: Yes, burst photos stored as HEIC can be converted. Each photo in the burst will be converted to a separate JPEG file.

faqs.question: Why do iPhones use HEIC?
faqs.answer: Apple adopted HEIC to save storage space - files are about half the size of JPEG with similar quality. However, this creates compatibility issues with non-Apple devices.

faqs.question: What is HEIC format?
faqs.answer: HEIC (High Efficiency Image Container) is Apple's default image format for photos taken on iPhone and iPad devices running iOS 11 or later. It uses HEIF compression to save storage space while maintaining high quality.

faqs.question: Why do I need to convert HEIC to JPG?
faqs.answer: While HEIC offers excellent compression, many devices, applications, and websites don't support it. Converting to JPG ensures your photos can be viewed and shared on any platform without compatibility issues.

faqs.question: Will converting HEIC to JPG reduce quality?
faqs.answer: Our converter maintains optimal quality during conversion. While JPG uses different compression, we ensure minimal quality loss while producing files that work everywhere.

faqs.question: Can I batch convert multiple HEIC files?
faqs.answer: Yes! You can drag and drop or select multiple HEIC files to convert them all to JPG at once. Each file is processed individually and downloaded automatically.

faqs.question: Is my privacy protected?
faqs.answer: Absolutely. All conversions happen locally in your browser. Your photos never leave your device and aren't uploaded to any server, ensuring complete privacy.

faqs.question: Why convert HEIC to PDF?
faqs.answer: PDF is ideal for sharing photos in documents, creating photo portfolios, or when you need images in a document format that preserves layout and can't be easily edited.

faqs.question: Can I combine multiple HEIC images into one PDF?
faqs.answer: Yes, you can select multiple HEIC files and combine them into a single multi-page PDF document, perfect for creating photo albums or portfolios.

faqs.question: What's the PDF quality like?
faqs.answer: The PDF maintains high quality with customizable compression settings. You can choose between high quality for printing or compressed for email sharing.

faqs.question: Are the PDFs searchable?
faqs.answer: The PDFs contain images only and are not searchable. For searchable PDFs, you would need OCR (Optical Character Recognition) software.

faqs.question: Can I set PDF page size?
faqs.answer: Yes, you can choose from standard page sizes (A4, Letter, etc.) or use auto-fit to match the image dimensions.

faqs.question: What is HEIF format?

faqs.question: Is HEIF the same as HEIC?
faqs.answer: HEIC is Apple's implementation of HEIF. While HEIF is the broader standard, HEIC specifically uses HEVC codec for compression. Both offer similar benefits over traditional formats.

faqs.question: Why convert HEIF to JPG?
faqs.answer: JPG has universal support across all devices and software. Converting HEIF to JPG ensures your images can be viewed, edited, and shared without compatibility issues.

faqs.question: Can I convert HEIF image sequences?
faqs.answer: Yes, HEIF files containing image sequences are supported. Each image in the sequence can be extracted and converted to individual JPG files.

tool.title: JFIF to JPEG

faqs.question: Are JFIF and JPEG the same format?
faqs.answer: Yes, JFIF (JPEG File Interchange Format) is just a specific type of JPEG file. The only difference is the file extension - the image data is identical.

faqs.question: Why do I have JFIF files?
faqs.answer: Some browsers and applications save JPEG images with the .jfif extension, particularly when downloading or copying images from websites.

faqs.question: Will conversion affect quality?
faqs.answer: No quality loss occurs since this is just renaming the extension. The image data remains exactly the same - only the file extension changes.

faqs.question: Which extension is better?
faqs.answer: JPEG (.jpeg or .jpg) is more widely recognized and compatible. While JFIF files work in most modern software, JPEG ensures maximum compatibility.

faqs.question: Is all data preserved?
faqs.answer: Yes, everything including image data, metadata, EXIF information, and color profiles remains unchanged during the conversion.

faqs.answer: Historical reasons - older Windows systems required 3-letter extensions (.jpg), while other systems used the full .jpeg. Both are now universally supported.

faqs.question: Which extension should I use?
faqs.answer: .jpg is more common and slightly more compatible with older systems, though both work everywhere in modern applications.

faqs.question: Are all properties preserved?

faqs.question: Is my data secure?

name: JPG to SVG
description: Convert JPG to vector SVG

tool.title: JPG to SVG
tool.subtitle: Convert JPG images to scalable vector graphics format.

faqs.question: How does raster to vector conversion work?
faqs.answer: The converter traces the shapes and colors in your JPG image to create vector paths. Simple graphics with clear shapes work best, while complex photos may result in large, detailed SVGs.

faqs.question: Will my photo look the same as SVG?
faqs.answer: Photos converted to SVG will have a stylized, posterized appearance. SVG works best for logos, icons, and simple graphics rather than photographic images.

faqs.question: What are the benefits of SVG?
faqs.answer: SVG files are infinitely scalable without quality loss, editable in design software, and often smaller than raster images for simple graphics. They're perfect for responsive web design.

faqs.question: Can I edit the resulting SVG?
faqs.answer: Yes, SVG files can be edited in vector graphics software like Illustrator, Inkscape, or even with a text editor since SVG is an XML-based format.

faqs.question: When should I use SVG instead of JPG?
faqs.answer: Use SVG for logos, icons, diagrams, and simple illustrations that need to scale. Keep JPG for photographs and complex images with many colors and details.

name: JSON to CSV
description: Convert JSON data to CSV format

tool.title: JSON to CSV
tool.subtitle: Convert JSON data to CSV format for spreadsheets and data analysis.

faqs.question: What is JSON?
faqs.answer: JSON (JavaScript Object Notation) is a lightweight, human-readable data format used for storing and exchanging structured data between systems. It uses key-value pairs and arrays to represent complex data structures.

faqs.question: Why convert JSON to CSV?
faqs.answer: CSV format is ideal for importing data into spreadsheet applications like Excel or Google Sheets, data analysis tools, and databases. It provides a simple tabular structure that's easy to work with.

faqs.question: How does nested JSON data get converted?
faqs.answer: Nested objects are flattened into columns using dot notation (e.g., 'address.city'), while arrays can be expanded into multiple rows or concatenated into single cells depending on your preference.

faqs.question: Can I customize the CSV output?
faqs.answer: Yes! You can choose which fields to include, set custom column headers, select delimiters (comma, tab, semicolon), and configure how arrays and nested objects are handled.

faqs.question: What's the maximum JSON file size?
faqs.answer: Our converter can handle JSON files up to 25MB. For larger datasets, consider splitting them or using specialized data processing tools.

faqs.question: Is my data secure?
faqs.answer: All processing happens locally in your browser. Your JSON data never leaves your device, ensuring complete privacy and security of sensitive information.

aboutSection.title: JSON vs CSV: Data Format Comparison

fromFormat.name: JSON
fromFormat.description: JSON is a language-independent open data format that uses human-readable text to express data objects consisting of attribute-value pairs. Although originally derived from JavaScript, JSON data can be generated and parsed with a wide variety of programming languages.

toFormat.name: CSV
toFormat.description: CSV is a simple file format used to store tabular data in plain text. Each line represents a data record, with fields separated by commas. It's universally supported by spreadsheet applications and databases.

tool.title: MP3 to Transcript
tool.subtitle: Transcribe MP3 audio to a text transcript from uploads or public links.

howTo.title: How to transcribe MP3 to a transcript
howTo.intro: Follow these steps to turn MP3 audio into a readable transcript.
steps: Upload an audio or video file, or paste a public link.
Wait while we extract the audio and transcribe it.
Download the transcript or copy the text.

infoArticle.title: About MP3 transcription
infoArticle.markdown:
MP3 to Transcript transcribes speech from audio or video files. Uploaded files are processed in your browser. If you paste a public link, the server fetches the media and streams it to your browser for transcription. The speech model downloads on first use and runs locally.

This tool is best for interviews, meetings, lectures, and voice notes. Larger files take longer to process and may use more memory.

**Why use this tool**

- Handles uploads or public links.
- Creates a plain text transcript you can edit or share.
- Works with common audio and video formats.

faqs.question: Do my files get uploaded?
faqs.answer: Uploads are processed locally in your browser. If you paste a public link, the server fetches the media and streams it to your browser. The model files are downloaded when needed.

faqs.question: Which file types are supported?
faqs.answer: Common audio and video formats like MP3, WAV, M4A, AAC, FLAC, OGG, OPUS, MP4, MOV, MKV, WEBM, AVI, and M4V.

faqs.question: Can I use YouTube or SoundCloud links?
faqs.answer: Yes for public links. Private or logged-in content is not supported yet.

faqs.question: Why is the first run slower?
faqs.answer: The speech model downloads the first time you run the tool. After that it is cached for faster use.

faqs.question: What does the output look like?
faqs.answer: You get a plain text transcript (.txt) that you can download or copy.

tool.title: MP4 to 3GP
tool.subtitle: Convert MP4 videos to 3GP format for mobile device compatibility

faqs.question: What is 3GP format?
faqs.answer: 3GP (3rd Generation Partnership Project) is a multimedia container format designed for 3G mobile phones. It's optimized for mobile transmission and playback on devices with limited processing power and storage.

faqs.question: Why convert MP4 to 3GP?
faqs.answer: Convert to 3GP for compatibility with older mobile phones, feature phones, or when you need smaller file sizes for mobile transmission over limited bandwidth connections.

faqs.question: How does 3GP quality compare to MP4?
faqs.answer: 3GP typically offers lower quality than MP4 due to aggressive compression optimized for mobile networks. It uses smaller resolutions and lower bitrates to ensure smooth playback on mobile devices.

faqs.question: Can modern smartphones play 3GP files?
faqs.answer: Yes, most modern smartphones can play 3GP files, but they're primarily designed for older mobile devices. For modern phones, MP4 provides better quality and is the preferred format.

faqs.question: What are typical 3GP file sizes?
faqs.answer: 3GP files are very small compared to MP4 - often 10-20MB for a full-length video that might be 100MB+ in MP4. This makes them ideal for sharing over mobile networks with data limitations.

faqs.question: Is the conversion process secure?
faqs.answer: Absolutely secure! All 3GP conversion happens locally in your browser. Your video files never leave your device, ensuring complete privacy during the conversion process.

name: MP4 to AAC

tool.title: MP4 to AAC
tool.subtitle: Extract high-efficiency AAC audio from MP4 videos with superior compression

faqs.question: What makes AAC better than MP3 for audio extraction?
faqs.answer: AAC provides better audio quality than MP3 at the same bitrate, with more efficient compression and better handling of complex audio. It's the modern successor to MP3 and the standard for digital audio.

faqs.question: Do all devices support AAC audio files?
faqs.answer: Yes! AAC is widely supported by modern devices, smartphones, tablets, and media players. It's the native audio format for Apple devices and supported by Android, Windows, and most streaming services.

faqs.question: How much smaller are AAC files compared to WAV?
faqs.answer: AAC files are dramatically smaller than WAV (roughly 90% smaller) while maintaining excellent audio quality. This makes AAC perfect for portable devices and streaming while preserving most of the original audio fidelity.

faqs.question: Can I use AAC files for professional audio work?
faqs.answer: AAC is suitable for many professional applications, especially broadcasting and streaming. However, for critical audio editing work, uncompressed formats like WAV or lossless formats like FLAC are preferred.

faqs.question: How fast is MP4 to AAC conversion?
faqs.answer: Very fast! AAC extraction typically takes 15-45 seconds per video since we're optimizing the existing audio stream. The process is much faster than full re-encoding while maintaining high quality.

faqs.question: Is my data secure during extraction?
faqs.answer: Completely secure! All AAC extraction happens locally in your browser using advanced audio processing. Your video files remain on your device throughout the entire process.

tool.title: MP4 to AIFF

faqs.question: What is AIFF audio format?
faqs.answer: AIFF (Audio Interchange File Format) is Apple's uncompressed audio format, similar to WAV but designed for Mac systems. It preserves original audio quality without any compression loss.

faqs.question: Why convert MP4 audio to AIFF?
faqs.answer: Convert to AIFF for professional audio editing, Mac-based workflows, or when you need uncompressed audio with maximum quality preservation for post-production work.

faqs.question: How does AIFF compare to WAV?
faqs.answer: AIFF and WAV are both uncompressed formats with identical audio quality. AIFF is Apple's standard while WAV is Microsoft's. AIFF files are slightly larger due to different metadata handling.

faqs.question: What are the file size implications of AIFF?
faqs.answer: AIFF files are large as they're uncompressed - roughly 10MB per minute of stereo audio at 44.1kHz/16-bit. They provide maximum quality but require significant storage space.

faqs.question: Is AIFF suitable for all audio applications?
faqs.answer: AIFF is ideal for professional audio editing and Mac-based production. For general listening or mobile use, compressed formats like MP3 or AAC are more practical due to smaller file sizes.

faqs.question: Is the conversion process secure?
faqs.answer: Absolutely secure! All AIFF conversion happens locally in your browser. Your video files never leave your device, ensuring complete privacy during audio extraction.

faqs.answer: ASF (Advanced Systems Format) is Microsoft's proprietary container format designed for Windows Media. It can contain video, audio, metadata, and is optimized for streaming over networks with Windows Media Services.

faqs.question: Why convert MP4 to ASF?
faqs.answer: Convert to ASF for compatibility with Windows Media Server, legacy Windows Media Player applications, or when working with Microsoft-centric media distribution systems that require ASF format.

faqs.question: How does ASF relate to WMV and WMA?
faqs.answer: ASF is the container format, while WMV (Windows Media Video) and WMA (Windows Media Audio) are the codecs used inside ASF containers. ASF files often have .wmv or .wma extensions based on content.

faqs.question: Can non-Windows devices play ASF files?
faqs.answer: ASF support varies by platform. While some media players like VLC can handle ASF files, they're primarily designed for Windows environments. MP4 offers better cross-platform compatibility.

faqs.question: Is ASF still relevant in modern streaming?
faqs.answer: ASF is mostly legacy technology, superseded by more modern streaming formats. It may still be needed for maintaining older Windows Media-based systems or legacy content management.

faqs.question: Is the conversion process secure?
faqs.answer: Completely secure! All ASF conversion happens locally in your browser. Your video files never leave your device, ensuring complete privacy during the conversion process.

faqs.question: Why would I convert MP4 to AVI?
faqs.answer: AVI format ensures compatibility with older Windows systems, legacy media players, and devices that don't support modern MP4 containers. It's essential for maintaining video libraries that need to work with older hardware or software.

faqs.question: Will AVI files be larger than MP4?
faqs.answer: Generally yes. AVI is an older format with less efficient compression than MP4. Expect file sizes to be 20-50% larger, but you gain compatibility with systems that can't handle modern video formats.

faqs.question: Does converting to AVI reduce video quality?
faqs.answer: Some quality loss may occur since AVI typically requires re-encoding the video stream. We use high-quality settings to minimize this, but MP4's modern compression is generally superior to AVI's older codecs.

faqs.question: Can all devices play AVI files?
faqs.answer: AVI has excellent compatibility with Windows systems and older devices, but limited support on mobile platforms and modern streaming devices. It's best for desktop use and legacy hardware compatibility.

faqs.question: How long does MP4 to AVI conversion take?
faqs.answer: Longer than container-only conversions since re-encoding is usually required. Expect 2-5x the video duration for conversion time, depending on file size and your device's processing power.

faqs.question: Is the conversion process secure?
faqs.answer: Completely secure! All video processing happens locally in your browser. Your files never leave your device, ensuring privacy while converting your videos to AVI format.

faqs.question: What is HEVC format?
faqs.answer: HEVC (High Efficiency Video Coding), also known as H.265, is a modern video compression standard that provides up to 50% better compression than H.264 while maintaining the same quality, making it ideal for 4K and high-resolution video.

faqs.question: Why convert MP4 to HEVC?
faqs.answer: Convert to HEVC to significantly reduce file sizes while maintaining quality, especially for 4K videos, long recordings, or when storage space is limited. HEVC is essential for efficient 4K and HDR video distribution.

faqs.question: How much smaller are HEVC files compared to H.264?
faqs.answer: HEVC files are typically 40-50% smaller than equivalent H.264 MP4 files at the same quality level. A 1GB H.264 video might be reduced to 500-600MB in HEVC format without quality loss.

faqs.question: What devices support HEVC playback?
faqs.answer: Modern devices including iPhone (iOS 11+), Android phones, 4K TVs, and computers with recent hardware support HEVC. However, older devices may require software players like VLC for HEVC playback.

faqs.question: Is HEVC worth the longer encoding time?
faqs.answer: Yes, for storage-critical applications. HEVC encoding takes 2-5x longer than H.264 but provides significant space savings, making it worthwhile for archival, 4K content, or bandwidth-limited distribution.

faqs.answer: Completely secure! All HEVC conversion happens locally in your browser. Your video files never leave your device, ensuring complete privacy during the conversion process.

faqs.question: What is MJPEG format?

faqs.question: Why convert MP4 to MJPEG?
faqs.answer: Convert to MJPEG for video editing applications where you need frame-accurate editing, low-latency processing, or when working with professional video equipment that requires intraframe compression.

faqs.question: How does MJPEG compare to MP4 for editing?
faqs.answer: MJPEG is superior for editing because every frame is independently encoded, allowing instant seeking and precise frame editing. MP4's interframe compression requires more processing for frame-accurate editing.

faqs.question: What are the file size implications of MJPEG?
faqs.answer: MJPEG files are significantly larger than MP4 because each frame is individually compressed without interframe compression. However, this provides the benefit of frame-independent editing.

faqs.question: What applications work best with MJPEG?
faqs.answer: MJPEG is ideal for video editing software, surveillance systems, scientific imaging, and any application requiring frame-accurate video processing or low-latency streaming.

faqs.question: Is the conversion process secure?
faqs.answer: Completely secure! All MJPEG conversion happens locally in your browser. Your video files never leave your device, ensuring complete privacy during the conversion process.

faqs.question: Why convert MP4 to MKV?
faqs.answer: MKV offers superior flexibility with unlimited audio tracks, subtitle streams, and chapter markers. It's perfect for archiving movies with multiple language options or storing video collections with complete metadata.

faqs.question: Will I lose quality during conversion?
faqs.answer: No quality loss occurs! We use stream copying technology that transfers your video and audio data directly without re-encoding, preserving 100% of the original quality while changing only the container format.

faqs.question: How fast is the conversion process?
faqs.answer: Extremely fast! Since we're only changing the container format and not re-encoding the media, most files convert in just a few seconds. Speed depends primarily on file size and your device's storage speed.

faqs.question: Can MKV files play everywhere?
faqs.answer: MKV has excellent support on modern devices and media players like VLC, but may have limited compatibility with older TVs or mobile devices compared to MP4. It's ideal for PC and media center use.

faqs.question: What's the file size difference?
faqs.answer: File sizes remain virtually identical when converting MP4 to MKV. The container overhead is minimal (typically less than 0.1%), so you get all the benefits of MKV without increasing storage requirements.

faqs.question: Is this conversion secure and private?
faqs.answer: Completely secure! All processing happens locally in your browser using WebAssembly. Your videos never leave your device, ensuring complete privacy and eliminating any upload/download requirements.

faqs.question: Why convert MP4 to MOV format?
faqs.answer: MOV is Apple's native video format, offering seamless integration with macOS, iOS, and professional editing software like Final Cut Pro. It provides better metadata support and is optimized for Apple's video processing pipeline.

faqs.question: Will converting to MOV improve video quality?
faqs.answer: The conversion preserves original quality when using our stream copy method. MOV doesn't inherently improve quality, but it offers better compatibility with Apple software and maintains all video metadata more effectively.

faqs.question: How quickly can I convert MP4 to MOV?
faqs.answer: Very fast! When the codecs are compatible, conversion takes only seconds since we copy the video stream directly without re-encoding. Large files may take a few minutes on slower devices.

faqs.question: Do MOV files work on Windows and Android?
faqs.answer: MOV files have limited support outside Apple's ecosystem. They work with VLC and some professional software on Windows, but MP4 is better for cross-platform compatibility. Choose MOV for Apple-centric workflows.

faqs.question: Can I edit MOV files more easily than MP4?
faqs.answer: Yes! MOV files are optimized for video editing, especially in Final Cut Pro, Adobe Premiere, and DaVinci Resolve. The format supports advanced metadata and timecode information that editors prefer.

faqs.question: Is my data safe during conversion?
faqs.answer: Absolutely secure! All processing occurs locally in your browser. Your videos remain on your device throughout the entire conversion process, ensuring complete privacy and data security.

faqs.question: What is MP2 audio format?
faqs.answer: MP2 (MPEG-1 Audio Layer II) is a digital audio compression format that precedes MP3. It's widely used in broadcasting, digital television, and radio transmission due to its robustness and professional audio quality.

faqs.question: Why convert to MP2 instead of MP3?
faqs.answer: MP2 is preferred for broadcasting and professional applications due to better error resilience, consistent quality, and lower computational requirements. It's the standard for digital radio and TV broadcasts.

faqs.question: How does MP2 audio quality compare to MP3?
faqs.answer: MP2 provides very good audio quality, especially at higher bitrates (256-384 kbps). While MP3 is more efficient at lower bitrates, MP2 offers better quality consistency for broadcast applications.

faqs.question: What are typical use cases for MP2 files?
faqs.answer: MP2 is used in digital radio broadcasting (DAB), digital TV audio tracks, professional audio equipment, and broadcast production where reliability and consistent quality are crucial.

faqs.question: Can standard media players play MP2 files?
faqs.answer: Most professional media players and software like VLC support MP2. However, consumer devices may have limited MP2 support compared to MP3, making MP3 better for general listening.

faqs.question: Is the conversion process secure?
faqs.answer: Completely secure! All MP2 conversion happens locally in your browser. Your video files never leave your device, ensuring complete privacy during audio extraction.

faqs.question: What is MPEG video format?
faqs.answer: MPEG (Moving Picture Experts Group) is a family of video compression standards. Classic MPEG-1 is used for VCDs and early digital video, while MPEG-2 is the DVD and broadcast TV standard.

faqs.question: Why convert MP4 to MPEG?
faqs.answer: Convert to MPEG for compatibility with legacy DVD players, older digital video systems, broadcast equipment, or when working with vintage video editing software that requires MPEG format.

faqs.question: What's the difference between MPEG-1 and MPEG-2?
faqs.answer: MPEG-1 offers lower quality/smaller files (VCD quality), while MPEG-2 provides higher quality suitable for DVD and broadcasting. MPEG-2 supports better resolutions and bitrates.

faqs.question: How does MPEG quality compare to MP4?
faqs.answer: Modern MP4 with H.264/H.265 provides much better quality and compression than classic MPEG-1/2. MPEG files are typically larger for equivalent quality but offer better compatibility with older systems.

faqs.question: Can I create DVDs from MPEG files?
faqs.answer: Yes! MPEG-2 is the standard video format for DVDs. Converting to MPEG-2 creates files that can be used for DVD authoring and burning, though you'll need additional software for full DVD creation.

faqs.question: Is the conversion process secure?
faqs.answer: Absolutely secure! All MPEG conversion happens locally in your browser. Your video files never leave your device, ensuring complete privacy during the conversion process.

faqs.question: Can I create DVDs from MPEG-2 files?

faqs.question: What bitrates work best for MPEG-2?

faqs.question: What is MPG format?

faqs.question: Is MPG the same as MPEG?
faqs.answer: MPG is simply a common file extension for MPEG video files. Both .mpg and .mpeg extensions typically contain the same MPEG-1 or MPEG-2 video content with identical quality and compatibility.

faqs.question: Why convert MP4 to MPG?
faqs.answer: Convert to MPG for compatibility with older media players, legacy video editing systems, or when creating content for VCD/SVCD formats that specifically require MPG files.

faqs.question: What quality should I expect from MPG files?
faqs.answer: MPG quality depends on the MPEG version used. MPEG-1 provides VCD quality (352x240), while MPEG-2 offers DVD quality (720x480 or higher). Both are lower efficiency than modern MP4.

faqs.question: Can all media players play MPG files?
faqs.answer: MPG has excellent compatibility with older media players and software. Most legacy systems that struggle with MP4 can handle MPG files without issues, making it ideal for broad compatibility.

faqs.question: What is MTS format?
faqs.answer: MTS (MPEG Transport Stream) is part of the AVCHD standard used by Sony and Panasonic camcorders. It contains H.264 video and AC-3 audio in a transport stream container designed for HD camcorders.

faqs.question: Why convert MP4 to MTS?
faqs.answer: Convert to MTS for compatibility with AVCHD camcorders, video editing software that expects MTS input, or when creating content for devices that specifically require MTS format files.

faqs.question: How does MTS relate to M2TS?
faqs.answer: MTS is used on camcorder memory cards, while M2TS is used on Blu-ray discs. Both use the same transport stream container but M2TS may have additional Blu-ray specific features and metadata.

faqs.question: Can I play MTS files on regular players?
faqs.answer: Most modern media players like VLC support MTS files. However, MTS is primarily designed for camcorders and professional video equipment rather than general media consumption.

faqs.question: What's the quality difference between MP4 and MTS?
faqs.answer: Both MP4 and MTS can use H.264 video, so quality can be similar. However, MTS uses transport stream containers which are more robust for recording but may result in slightly larger file sizes.

faqs.question: Is the conversion process secure?
faqs.answer: Absolutely secure! All MTS conversion happens locally in your browser. Your video files never leave your device, ensuring complete privacy during the conversion process.

infoArticle.title: About MP4 transcription
infoArticle.markdown:
MP4 to Transcript transcribes speech from audio or video files. Uploaded files are processed in your browser. If you paste a public link, the server fetches the media and streams it to your browser for transcription. The speech model downloads on first use and runs locally.

This tool is best for interviews, meetings, lectures, and voice notes. Larger files take longer to process and may use more memory.

**Why use this tool**

- Handles uploads or public links.
- Creates a plain text transcript you can edit or share.
- Works with common audio and video formats.

faqs.question: Do my files get uploaded?
faqs.answer: Uploads are processed locally in your browser. If you paste a public link, the server fetches the media and streams it to your browser. The model files are downloaded when needed.

faqs.question: Which file types are supported?
faqs.answer: Common audio and video formats like MP3, WAV, M4A, AAC, FLAC, OGG, OPUS, MP4, MOV, MKV, WEBM, AVI, and M4V.

faqs.question: Can I use YouTube or SoundCloud links?
faqs.answer: Yes for public links. Private or logged-in content is not supported yet.

faqs.question: Why is the first run slower?
faqs.answer: The speech model downloads the first time you run the tool. After that it is cached for faster use.

faqs.question: What does the output look like?
faqs.answer: You get a plain text transcript (.txt) that you can download or copy.

faqs.question: Why convert MP4 to TS format?
faqs.answer: TS (Transport Stream) is the standard for digital broadcasting, live streaming, and IPTV applications. It's designed for transmission over networks with potential packet loss and provides better error recovery than MP4.

faqs.question: What are TS files used for?
faqs.answer: TS files are used for digital TV broadcasting, live streaming services, IPTV systems, and network transmission where error resilience is crucial. They're the backbone of modern digital television.

faqs.question: How do TS files handle streaming better than MP4?
faqs.answer: TS format includes error correction, packet-level addressing, and can carry multiple programs in one stream. This makes it ideal for live broadcasting and streaming over unreliable networks.

faqs.question: Can I play TS files on regular media players?
faqs.answer: Yes! Most modern media players including VLC support TS files. However, TS is primarily designed for streaming and broadcasting rather than local playback.

faqs.question: How long does MP4 to TS conversion take?
faqs.answer: TS conversion can be fast when using stream copying for compatible codecs, taking just minutes. Full re-encoding may take longer but provides optimal streaming compatibility.

faqs.question: Is the conversion process secure?
faqs.answer: Completely secure! All TS conversion happens locally in your browser. Your video files never leave your device during the entire conversion process.

name: MP4 to VOB
description: Convert MP4 video files to VOB format

tool.title: MP4 to VOB
tool.subtitle: Convert MP4 videos to VOB format for DVD compatibility

faqs.question: What is VOB format?
faqs.answer: VOB (Video Object) is the container format used on DVD discs. It contains MPEG-2 video, AC-3 or DTS audio, subtitles, and DVD navigation information, making it the standard format for DVD video content.

faqs.question: Why convert MP4 to VOB?
faqs.answer: Convert to VOB for creating DVDs, ensuring compatibility with DVD players, or when working with DVD authoring software that specifically requires VOB files for menu creation and disc burning.

faqs.question: Can I play VOB files without a DVD player?
faqs.answer: Yes! Most media players like VLC can play VOB files directly. However, VOB files are specifically designed for DVD players and may lack some navigation features when played standalone.

faqs.question: What video quality should I expect from VOB?
faqs.answer: VOB uses MPEG-2 compression with DVD-standard resolutions (720x480 NTSC or 720x576 PAL). Quality is good for DVD standards but lower than modern MP4 with H.264/H.265 compression.

faqs.question: How large are VOB files compared to MP4?
faqs.answer: VOB files are typically larger than equivalent MP4 files due to MPEG-2's lower compression efficiency. A 2-hour movie might be 4-8GB in VOB format compared to 1-2GB for optimized MP4.

faqs.question: Is the conversion process secure?
faqs.answer: Completely secure! All VOB conversion happens locally in your browser. Your video files never leave your device, ensuring complete privacy during the conversion process.

name: MP4 to WAV
description: Extract WAV audio from MP4 video files

tool.title: MP4 to WAV
tool.subtitle: Extract uncompressed WAV audio from MP4 videos for professional audio editing

faqs.question: Why extract WAV instead of MP3 from MP4 videos?
faqs.answer: WAV provides uncompressed, lossless audio quality perfect for professional editing, music production, and archival purposes. Unlike MP3, WAV preserves every detail of the original audio without any compression artifacts.

faqs.question: How large are WAV files compared to MP3?
faqs.answer: WAV files are significantly larger than MP3 (typically 10x the size) because they contain uncompressed audio data. This trade-off provides perfect audio quality but requires more storage space.

faqs.question: Can I edit WAV files in audio editing software?
faqs.answer: Absolutely! WAV is the preferred format for professional audio editing software like Audacity, Pro Tools, and Logic Pro. The uncompressed format allows for precise editing without quality degradation.

faqs.question: Do WAV files work on all devices?
faqs.answer: WAV files have excellent compatibility with computers and professional audio equipment, but limited support on mobile devices due to large file sizes. Convert to MP3 for portable devices after editing.

faqs.question: How fast is MP4 to WAV extraction?
faqs.answer: Very fast! Since we're extracting and converting to uncompressed audio, the process typically takes 30-60 seconds per video, depending on the length and your device's processing speed.

faqs.question: Is the extraction process secure?
faqs.answer: Completely secure! All audio extraction and WAV conversion happens locally in your browser. Your video files never leave your device, ensuring total privacy and security.

name: MP4 to WebM
description: Convert MP4 video files to WebM format

tool.title: MP4 to WebM
tool.subtitle: Convert MP4 videos to WebM format for optimized web streaming and HTML5 compatibility

faqs.question: Why convert MP4 to WebM for web use?
faqs.answer: WebM offers superior compression efficiency and is completely royalty-free, making it ideal for web streaming. It's natively supported by all modern browsers and provides better quality at smaller file sizes than MP4.

faqs.question: Do all browsers support WebM files?
faqs.answer: Yes! All modern browsers including Chrome, Firefox, Safari, and Edge support WebM playback. It's the preferred format for HTML5 video on the web due to its open-source nature and efficient compression.

faqs.question: How much smaller are WebM files compared to MP4?
faqs.answer: WebM files are typically 20-30% smaller than equivalent quality MP4 files thanks to the VP8/VP9 codecs. This means faster loading times and reduced bandwidth costs for web applications.

faqs.question: Can I use WebM files outside of web browsers?
faqs.answer: WebM works great in VLC and other media players, but has limited support on mobile devices and gaming consoles. It's primarily designed for web use, so stick with MP4 for broader device compatibility.

faqs.question: How long does MP4 to WebM conversion take?
faqs.answer: WebM conversion is slower than container changes since it requires re-encoding with VP8/VP9 codecs. Expect conversion to take 3-7x the video duration, but the quality and size benefits are worth it for web use.

faqs.question: Is the conversion process private and secure?
faqs.answer: Absolutely! All WebM encoding happens locally in your browser using WebAssembly. Your videos stay on your device throughout the entire conversion process, ensuring complete privacy.

name: MP4 to WMA
description: Extract audio from MP4 videos and convert to WMA format

tool.title: MP4 to WMA
tool.subtitle: Extract audio from MP4 videos and convert to Windows Media Audio format

faqs.question: What is WMA audio format?
faqs.answer: WMA (Windows Media Audio) is Microsoft's proprietary audio compression format, designed as an alternative to MP3 with similar quality at smaller file sizes, particularly optimized for Windows Media Player.

faqs.question: Why extract audio to WMA from MP4?
faqs.answer: Extract to WMA for Windows-based audio systems, older Windows Media Player compatibility, or when working with Microsoft-centric media workflows that require WMA format.

faqs.question: How does WMA quality compare to MP3?
faqs.answer: WMA generally provides comparable or slightly better quality than MP3 at the same bitrates, especially at lower bitrates. However, MP3 has much wider device and software compatibility.

faqs.question: Can I play WMA files on non-Windows devices?
faqs.answer: WMA support varies by device. While Windows devices play WMA natively, Apple devices and many mobile players require third-party apps. MP3 or AAC offer better cross-platform compatibility.

faqs.question: What audio settings work best for WMA conversion?
faqs.answer: For good quality WMA audio, use 128-192 kbps bitrate. WMA performs well at these bitrates while maintaining reasonable file sizes, making it suitable for music and speech content.

faqs.question: Is the conversion process secure?
faqs.answer: Completely secure! All WMA conversion happens locally in your browser. Your video files never leave your device, ensuring complete privacy during audio extraction.

name: PDF to JPG
description: Convert PDF pages to JPG images

tool.title: PDF to JPG
tool.subtitle: Extract high-quality JPG images from PDF documents instantly

faqs.question: How are multi-page PDFs handled?
faqs.answer: Each page of your PDF is converted to a separate JPG image, numbered sequentially (page1.jpg, page2.jpg, etc.). This makes it easy to work with individual pages or share specific content.

faqs.question: What resolution are the JPG images?
faqs.answer: Images are rendered at high resolution (2x scale) to ensure clarity. The output maintains the PDF's visual quality while being suitable for web use, printing, or sharing.

faqs.question: Can I convert password-protected PDFs?
faqs.answer: Currently, only unprotected PDFs can be converted. Password-protected or encrypted PDFs need to be unlocked first using PDF software before conversion.

faqs.question: What about text in PDFs?
faqs.answer: Text is rendered as part of the image. The JPG output will show all text exactly as it appears in the PDF, but it won't be selectable or searchable as text.

faqs.question: Are forms and annotations preserved?
faqs.answer: Yes, all visible elements including form fields, annotations, stamps, and comments are rendered in the JPG output as they appear in the PDF.

name: PDF to PNG

tool.title: PDF to PNG
tool.subtitle: Convert PDF pages to high-quality PNG images with transparency.

faqs.question: Why choose PNG over JPG for PDFs?
faqs.answer: PNG is better for PDFs containing text, diagrams, or graphics as it provides lossless compression and sharper edges. It also supports transparency for PDFs with transparent backgrounds.

faqs.question: What resolution are the PNG files?
faqs.answer: PNGs are generated at 150 DPI by default, with options up to 300 DPI for print quality. Higher resolutions produce sharper images but larger file sizes.

faqs.question: Can I convert specific pages only?
faqs.answer: Yes, you can select specific pages or page ranges to convert, rather than processing the entire document.

faqs.question: Are transparent PDFs supported?
faqs.answer: Yes, PDFs with transparent backgrounds are converted to PNGs with alpha channel transparency preserved.

faqs.question: How are vector PDFs handled?
faqs.answer: Vector content in PDFs is rasterized at your chosen resolution. For best quality with vector content, use higher DPI settings.

faqs.question: What is PNG format?
faqs.answer: Lossless compression format with transparency support

faqs.question: Why convert PNG to JPG?
faqs.answer: Converting from PNG to JPG can provide benefits like excellent compression, universal compatibility, good for photographs.

faqs.question: Will I lose quality during conversion?
faqs.answer: Converting from lossless PNG to JPG involves compression, which may result in some quality loss. We use optimal settings to minimize any visible differences.

faqs.question: Is my data secure?
faqs.answer: Yes! All conversions happen locally in your browser. Your files never leave your device and aren't uploaded to any server, ensuring complete privacy and security.

faqs.question: Can I convert multiple files at once?
faqs.answer: Yes! You can select and convert multiple files simultaneously. Each file is processed individually and downloaded automatically when ready.

faqs.question: What's the maximum file size?
faqs.answer: Since processing happens in your browser, the limit depends on your device's available memory. Most modern devices can handle files up to several hundred megabytes.

name: TikTok to Transcript
description: Transcribe TikTok videos to a text transcript

tool.title: TikTok to Transcript
tool.subtitle: Transcribe TikTok videos to a text transcript from public links or uploads.

howTo.title: How to transcribe TikTok videos to a transcript
howTo.intro: Follow these steps to turn a TikTok video into a readable transcript.
steps: Upload an audio or video file, or paste a public link.
Wait while we extract the audio and transcribe it.
Download the transcript or copy the text.

infoArticle.title: About TikTok transcription
infoArticle.markdown:
TikTok to Transcript transcribes speech from audio or video files. Uploaded files are processed in your browser. If you paste a public link, the server fetches the media and streams it to your browser for transcription. The speech model downloads on first use and runs locally.

This tool is best for interviews, meetings, lectures, and voice notes. Larger files take longer to process and may use more memory.

**Why use this tool**

- Handles uploads or public links.
- Creates a plain text transcript you can edit or share.
- Works with common audio and video formats.

faqs.question: Do my files get uploaded?
faqs.answer: Uploads are processed locally in your browser. If you paste a public link, the server fetches the media and streams it to your browser. The model files are downloaded when needed.

faqs.question: Which file types are supported?
faqs.answer: Common audio and video formats like MP3, WAV, M4A, AAC, FLAC, OGG, OPUS, MP4, MOV, MKV, WEBM, AVI, and M4V.

faqs.question: Can I use YouTube or SoundCloud links?
faqs.answer: Yes for public links. Private or logged-in content is not supported yet.

faqs.question: Why is the first run slower?
faqs.answer: The speech model downloads the first time you run the tool. After that it is cached for faster use.

faqs.question: What does the output look like?
faqs.answer: You get a plain text transcript (.txt) that you can download or copy.

steps: Paste a public video link.

infoArticle.title: About video downloads
infoArticle.markdown:
Video Downloader fetches media from public links and prepares a downloadable file. It works for direct video files and many public video pages.

For private or logged-in content, downloads are not supported yet. If a link fails, try a different public source or direct file URL.

**Why use this tool**

- Quick downloads for public links.
- Works on desktop and mobile browsers.
- Saves a video file you can keep or share.

faqs.question: Which links work?
faqs.answer: Public links from services like YouTube, Vimeo, Loom, or direct video file URLs. Private or logged-in content is not supported yet.

faqs.question: What file type do I get?
faqs.answer: Most downloads are MP4 or WebM, depending on what the source provides.

faqs.question: Do you store my videos?
faqs.answer: No. We fetch the media and stream it to you; files are not stored after download.

faqs.question: Why did my link fail?
faqs.answer: Some links require login or block downloads. Try a public link or a direct video file URL.

Wait while we extract the audio and transcribe it.
Download the transcript or copy the text.

infoArticle.title: About video transcription
infoArticle.markdown:
Video to Transcript transcribes speech from audio or video files. Uploaded files are processed in your browser. If you paste a public link, the server fetches the media and streams it to your browser for transcription. The speech model downloads on first use and runs locally.

This tool is best for interviews, meetings, lectures, and voice notes. Larger files take longer to process and may use more memory.

**Why use this tool**

- Handles uploads or public links.
- Creates a plain text transcript you can edit or share.
- Works with common audio and video formats.

faqs.question: Do my files get uploaded?
faqs.answer: Uploads are processed locally in your browser. If you paste a public link, the server fetches the media and streams it to your browser. The model files are downloaded when needed.

faqs.question: Which file types are supported?
faqs.answer: Common audio and video formats like MP3, WAV, M4A, AAC, FLAC, OGG, OPUS, MP4, MOV, MKV, WEBM, AVI, and M4V.

faqs.question: Can I use YouTube or SoundCloud links?
faqs.answer: Yes for public links. Private or logged-in content is not supported yet.

faqs.question: Why is the first run slower?
faqs.answer: The speech model downloads the first time you run the tool. After that it is cached for faster use.

faqs.question: What does the output look like?
faqs.answer: You get a plain text transcript (.txt) that you can download or copy.

name: WebP to PNG
description: Convert WebP images to PNG

tool.title: WebP to PNG
tool.subtitle: Convert WebP images to PNG format with transparency support.

faqs.question: Is transparency preserved when converting?
faqs.answer: Yes, WebP images with transparency (alpha channel) are converted to PNG with full transparency support. The alpha channel is perfectly preserved.

faqs.question: Why convert WebP to PNG?
faqs.answer: While WebP offers better compression, PNG has universal support across all software, browsers, and devices. PNG is also required for many design tools and older systems.

faqs.question: Will the file size increase?
faqs.answer: Yes, PNG files are typically 30-50% larger than WebP. However, PNG offers lossless compression and universal compatibility, making it worth the trade-off in many cases.

faqs.question: Can I batch convert multiple WebP files?
faqs.answer: Yes, you can select or drag multiple WebP files for batch conversion. Each file is processed and downloaded automatically.

faqs.question: Are animated WebP files supported?
faqs.answer: Static WebP images are fully supported. Animated WebP files will be converted to a static PNG of the first frame.
